com.mway.bluerange.android.sdk.services

Class RelutionIoTService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • com.mway.bluerange.android.sdk.services.BlueRangeService
            • com.mway.bluerange.android.sdk.services.RelutionIoTService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class RelutionIoTService
extends BlueRangeService
    This service class unites all features that are currently supported by the SDK and provides an easy to use interface, so that it is not necessary to know all the details of the underlying message processing architecture. Before starting this service with one of the start methods defined in the base class, you must call the setLoginData(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, com.mway.bluerange.android.sdk.services.RelutionIoTService.LoginObserver) method, where you pass the Relution server URL, the organization UUID and the login data. After the service has been started, you can register different observers to get informed about incoming beacon messages, Relution tags or executed actions. Moreover, you can use this class to calibrate iBeacon messages.

    • Method Detail

      • addBeaconMessageObserver

        public static void addBeaconMessageObserver(RelutionIoTService.BeaconMessageObserver observer)
        Adds a RelutionIoTService.BeaconMessageObserver observer to the list of all observers. The onMessageReceived method will be called, whenever a message was received that was added to a beacon in the Relution platform. Notice: If you want to scan for messages that were not added to a beacon on the Relution platform, you must create your own BeaconMessageScanner instance, configure it to scan for these messages and register a receiver to get informed about these messages.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be added to the list of all observers.

      • addBeaconTagActionObserver

        public static void addBeaconTagActionObserver(RelutionIoTService.BeaconTagActionObserver observer)
        Adds a RelutionIoTService.BeaconTagActionObserver observer to the list of all observers. The onTagActionExecuted method will be called, whenever an 'visited' action was executed.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be added to the list of all observers.

      • addBeaconContentActionObserver

        public static void addBeaconContentActionObserver(RelutionIoTService.BeaconContentActionObserver observer)
        Adds a RelutionIoTService.BeaconContentActionObserver observer to the list of all observers. The onContentActionExecuted method will be called, whenever a 'content' action was executed.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be added to the list of all observers.

      • addBeaconNotificationActionObserver

        public static void addBeaconNotificationActionObserver(RelutionIoTService.BeaconNotificationActionObserver observer)
        Adds a RelutionIoTService.BeaconNotificationActionObserver observer to the list of all observers. The onNotificationActionExecuted method will be called, whenever a 'notification' action was executed.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be added to the list of all observers.

      • addRelutionTagObserver

        public static void addRelutionTagObserver(RelutionIoTService.RelutionTagObserver observer)
        Adds a RelutionIoTService.RelutionTagObserver observer to the list of all observers. The onTagReceived method will be called, whenever a Relution tag was received from a beacon.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer that will be added to the list of all observers.

      • addPolicyTriggerObserver

        public static void addPolicyTriggerObserver(RelutionIoTService.PolicyTriggerObserver observer)

      • setOfflineMode

        public RelutionIoTService setOfflineMode(boolean offlineMode)
        If using the offline mode, the login will always succeed. However, all requests to the server are mocked basically doing nothing. This mode can be important, when the user does not have Internet access, however wants to use basic functionality like scanning BeaconJoinMe or Asset messages.
        Parameters:
        offlineMode - true, if offlineMode should be enabled.
        Returns:
        The service instance.

      • setLoginData

        public RelutionIoTService setLoginData(java.lang.String baseUrl,
                                       java.lang.String username,
                                       java.lang.String password,
                                       RelutionIoTService.LoginObserver observer)
        Sets the required Relution URL, organization UUID, Username and Password. Notice: This method must be called before the service is started.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - The URL to the Relution server, e.g. "https://iot.relution.io".
        username - The Relution username you use to login.
        password - The Relution password you use to login.
        Returns:
        The same instance of this class.

        Enables/disables logging debug messages. Disabling logging might increase the performance of your app.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true, if logging should be enabled.
        Returns:
        The same instance of this class.

        public RelutionIoTService setCampaignActionTriggerEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables executing actions that are defined inside a campaign and assigned to specific beacons in Relution.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true, if action execution should be enabled.
        Returns:
        The same instance of this class.

      • setHeatmapGenerationEnabled

        public RelutionIoTService setHeatmapGenerationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables sending specific advertising messages being used to generate and display the heatmap in Relution.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true, if heatmap generation should be enabled.
        Returns:
        The same instance of this class.

      • setSendingAnalyticsDataEnabled

        public RelutionIoTService setSendingAnalyticsDataEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables periodically sending status reports to Relution. The reports collect the received signal strength of all detected beacons for each small time interval since this service has been started.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true, if heatmap reporting should be enabled.
        Returns:
        The same instance of this class.

      • isRunning

        public static boolean isRunning()

      • getTagInfoForTag

        public static RelutionTagInfo getTagInfoForTag(long tag)
                                        throws RelutionTagInfoRegistry.RelutionTagInfoRegistryNoInfoFound
        Requests the Relution tag information for the passed tag from Relution.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag identifier, which the Relution tag information should be requested for.
        Returns:
        A new RelutionTagInfo instance containing the information for the tag.
        Throws:
        RelutionTagInfoRegistry.RelutionTagInfoRegistryNoInfoFound - will be thrown, when this tag has not been defined in Relution.

      • calibrateIBeacon

        public static void calibrateIBeacon(IBeacon iBeacon,
                                    float txPower)
        Changes the txPower field of an iBeacon message assigned to a beacon in Relution. This method can be used to calibrate an iBeacon message for the assigned beacon in order to improve distance estimation used e.g. in campaign actions that make use of a distance threshold.
        Parameters:
        iBeacon - The iBeacon which should be calibrated.
        txPower - The txPower field, which is the same as the received signal strength (RSSI) at one meter distance away from the beacon.
